SRP.A: The peak of  Transportation is to the {left} of the peak of Dining.

EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Dining} has the highest peak.

EVJ.A: At X =9843.3,the label with the highest density is {Adventure Activities}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 7017? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Sightseeing}'s peak at {7778},{Cultural Experiences}'s peak at {7748},{Adventure Activities}'s peak at {8018}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 3123? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Nightlife}'s peak at {791},{Transportation}'s peak at {1542},{Dining}'s peak at {2683},{Shopping}'s peak at {1301}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Transportation or Sightseeing?
NC.A: {Sightseeing} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Transportation or Dining?
NC.A: {Dining} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Dining}
